SEARCH
Package com.comp2042.model

Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
Default implementation of the Board interface. Manages the game state, including the grid matrix, the current falling brick, collision detection, and row clearing logic.

  • Constructor Summary

    Creates a new SimpleBoard with the specified dimensions.

    • SimpleBoard

      public SimpleBoard(int width, int height)
      Creates a new SimpleBoard with the specified dimensions.
      Parameters:
      width - The number of rows in the board.
      height - The number of columns in the board.

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      public boolean moveBrickDown()
      Attempts to move the current brick down by one row. Uses MatrixOperations to check for collisions.
      Specified by:
      moveBrickDown in interface Board
      Returns:
      True if the move was successful, false if it was blocked.

    • hardDrop

      public void hardDrop()
      Instantly drops the current brick to the lowest possible position. Calculates the shadow position and moves the brick directly to it.
      Specified by:
      hardDrop in interface Board

    • moveBrickLeft

      public boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Attempts to move the current brick one column to the left.
      Specified by:

      Returns:
      True if the move was successful, false if it was blocked.

      Attempts to move the current brick one column to the right.
      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • rotateLeftBrick

      public boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Attempts to rotate the current brick to the left (counter-clockwise). Implements the Super Rotation System (SRS) wall kicks to allow rotation in tight spaces.
      Specified by:
      rotateLeftBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      True if the rotation was successful, false if it was blocked.

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Spawns a new brick at the top of the board. Centers the new brick based on the board width.
      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      True if the new brick can be placed, false if it collides immediately (Game Over).

    • getBoardMatrix

      public int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Gets the current state of the board as a 2D integer array.
      Specified by:
      getBoardMatrix in interface Board
      Returns:
      The board matrix where values represent block colors.

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Gets the view data for the current brick, including its position, shape, and shadow.
      Specified by:
      getViewData in interface Board
      Returns:
      The ViewData object containing brick render information.

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current falling brick into the board's static background matrix. This is called when a brick locks into place.
      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Checks for and clears any completed rows in the board.
      Specified by:
      clearRows in interface Board
      Returns:
      A ClearRow object containing information about cleared lines and the new board state.
